data.text: And David spoke to the Lord the words of this song, in the day in which the Lord rescued him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul.
And the song was thus:
My God; he shall be to me my guard, I will trust in him:
I will call upon the Lord who is worthy to be praised,
For the troubles of death compassed me,
The pangs of death surrounded me,
When I am afflicted I will call upon the Lord,
And the earth was troubled and quaked,
There went up a smoke in his wrath,
And he bowed the heavens, and came down,
And he rode upon the cherubs and did fly,
And he made darkness his hiding place;
At the brightness before him
The Lord thundered out of heaven,
And he sent forth arrows, and scattered them,
And the channels of the sea were seen,
He sent from above and took me;
He delivered me from my strong enemies,
The days of my affliction prevented me;
And he brought me into a wide place,
And the Lord recompensed me according to my righteousness;
Because I kept the ways of the Lord,
For all his judgments and his ordinances were before me:
And I shall be blameless before him,
And the Lord will recompense me according to my righteousness,
With the holy thou wilt be holy,
And with the excellent thou wilt be excellent,
And thou wilt save the poor people,
For thou, Lord, art my lamp,
For by thee shall I run as a girded man,
As for the Mighty One, his way is blameless:
Who is strong, but the Lord?
It is the Mighty One who strengthens me with might,
He makes my feet like hartsâ€™ feet,
He teaches my hands to war,
And thou hast given me the shield of my salvation,
So as to make room under me for my going,
I will pursue my enemies, and will utterly destroy them;
And I will crush them, and they shall not rise;
And thou shalt strengthen me with power for the war;
And thou hast caused mine enemies to flee before me,
They shall cry, and there shall be no helper;
And I ground them as the dust of the earth,
And thou shalt deliver me from the striving of the peoples,
The strange children feigned obedience to me;
The strange children shall be cast away,
The Lord lives, and blessed be my guardian,
The Lord who avenges me is strong,
And bringing me out from my enemies:
Therefore will I confess to thee, O Lord, among the Gentiles,
He magnifies the salvation of his king,
